title.narrative: Climate Adaptation in Coastal Communities of Myanmar: Improved Management of Mangrove Forests

description.narrative:
Danish support to coastal climate adaptation in Myanmar focuses on en-hancing the Forest Department’s capacity to advocate for, establish and enforce Protected Public Forests (PPFs), Community Forestry establish-ment, restoration and rehabilitation of forests in Rakhine and Tanintharyi mangrove-coastal areas, and provision of livelihood opportunities and enhancing their resilience to climate change.
The project was originally expected to run up until end of 2023. The program was terminated as of 11 Feb 2022 following the military coup.

The overall strategic objective of the engagement is contribution to: Developing countries achieve low-carbon, climate resilient development and are able to implement the Paris agreement
The thematic objective is: Resilience to climate change among vulnerable and marginalised groups increased through sustainable development of mangrove forests
